title: Building an Aboveground Solar Still
brief: Construct a solar still using vegetation to extract moisture from plants through condensation.
steps: Step 1: Find a sunny slope and gather a clear plastic bag, green leafy vegetation, and a small rock.
Step 2: Fill the bag with air by scooping air into it or turning the opening into the breeze.
Step 3: Fill the bag half to three-fourths full with green leafy vegetation, removing all sharp sticks or spines.
Step 4: Place a small rock inside the bag to create a low point.
Step 5: Close and tie the bag mouth securely as close to the end as possible to maximize air space.
Step 6: If available, insert tubing into the mouth before tying, then plug the tube end.
Step 7: Place the bag mouth-downhill on the sunny slope with the mouth slightly higher than the low point.
Step 8: Position so the rock settles into the lowest point of the bag.
Step 9: After 24 hours, collect water by loosening the tie and draining water around the rock.
warnings: Never use poisonous vegetation - it will produce poisonous liquid.
Remove all sharp objects that could puncture the bag.
Change vegetation after extracting most water to ensure continued production.
